channel.title: Events on Digital.gov
channel.description: Recent content in Events on Digital.gov

item.title: USWDS Monthly Call - January 2025
item.description: Learn the U.S. Web Design System basics, how to get started with the design system, and what’s coming next for USWDS in 2025.

item.title: USWDS Monthly Call - December 2024
item.description: The U.S. Web Design System team is joined by the Federal Website Standards team to share more about the standards, their origin, the research backing them, and what standards are coming next.

item.title: USWDS Monthly Call - November 2024
item.description: The U.S. Web Design System (USWDS) team will share their vision for the design system as a product, including USWDS Web Components and other new things the team expects to deliver in 2025.

item.title: Multilingual search engine optimization (SEO)
item.description: Understand how search engines work, how people search online, and who is your audience — while recognizing language and cultural differences.

item.title: USWDS Monthly Call - October 2024
item.description: The U.S. Web Design System team will share the product and engineering principles they’re using to guide the development of the design system. event_organizer: Digital.gov

item.title: USWDS Monthly Call - September 2024
item.description: The U.S. Web Design System team will share their exploration of Web Component-based design systems and best practices.

item.title: USWDS Monthly Call - August 2024
item.description: The U.S. Web Design System team will answer community questions and give an update on their work developing web components for the design system.

item.title: USWDS Monthly Call - June 2024
item.description: The U.S. Web Design System team will give an update on their work developing web components for the design system.

item.title: USWDS Monthly Call - May 2024
item.description: The U.S. Web Design System (USWDS) team will chat with Center for Civic Design co-founder Whitney Quesenbery about designing accessible civic spaces.

item.title: USWDS Monthly Call - April 2024
item.description: The U.S. Web Design System (USWDS) team will go over some basics of Web Components and how they apply to the design system.

item.title: USWDS Monthly Call - March 2024
item.description: Join the U.S. Web Design System team for a lesson on customizing and extending the design system.

item.title: Spring 2024 Community Summit
item.description: Digital service experts across the federal government will share case studies and best practices on delivering a digital-first public experience.

item.title: USWDS Monthly Call - February 2024
item.description: Learn about the USWDS component lifecycle, and how you can suggest a new component.

item.title: USWDS Monthly Call - January 2024
item.description: This month the Design System team will talk about the development and rollout of their new accessibility tests for components.

item.title: USWDS Monthly Call - November 2023
item.description: The USWDS team will continue sharing our progress to improve ongoing research, publishing results and addressing recent findings.

item.title: USWDS Monthly Call - October 2023
item.description: This month, we’ll share progress and findings from our recent effort to improve our ongoing research practice.

item.title: Backlogs and why every website needs one
item.description: Join us as we discuss the concept and importance of backlogs and hear real-world examples of successful application in various GSA products and programs.

item.title: USWDS Monthly Call - September 2023
item.description: We’ll explore what it means to pursue mission-centered design and decision-making.

item.title: Cultivating a dynamic career in UX
item.description: Join us for a discussion on how to adapt your career in user experience (UX) to a quickly changing world.

item.title: USWDS Monthly Call - August 2023
item.description: What’s in the newest iteration of the U.S. Web Design System’s product roadmap.

item.title: USWDS Monthly Call - June 2023
item.description: Developing and evaluating content for manual accessibility and user experience (UX) tests

item.title: 2023 Government UX Summit
item.description: User experience (UX) experts across the federal government shared case studies and best practices during this virtual summit.

item.title: Strengthening information accessibility for consumers with limited English proficiency
item.description: Tune in to learn what the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) is doing to ensure financial products and services are accessible to all consumers, including those with limited English proficiency.

item.title: USWDS Monthly Call - May 2023
item.description: Join us as we observe Global Accessibility Awareness Day and talk about the real-world experience of blind users on the web.

item.title: Incorporating user experience practices into data-driven development of a biomedical software tool
item.description: Join the National Cancer Institute and a university-based researcher to discuss interpreting complex data.

item.title: USWDS Monthly Call - April 2023
item.description: Tune-in to learn more about what your feedback is doing for the U.S. Web Design System.

item.title: USWDS Monthly Call - March 2023
item.description: Making sense: Cognition, perception, and design

item.title: The plain language tie to translating digital content
item.description: Join us to discuss the plain language and cultural components of effectively translating digital content into multiple languages.

item.title: Working with the public to improve digital forms: A GSA case study
item.description: GSA’s Office of Evaluation Sciences shares how five offices worked with the public to improve digital forms.

item.title: USWDS Monthly Call - February 2023
item.description: Join us as we take a deep dive into USWDS design tokens. We’ll cover: what they are, how they’re used, and how you can adapt them to your branding needs.

item.title: Increasing public participation in user research
item.description: Join GSA’s 10x team as they share their report on creative incentives and tools for increased public participation in user research.

item.title: Continuously improve your website by using customer feedback and web analytics: An IRS case study
item.description: Get tips and lessons learned from the Internal Revenue Service on how they collect user feedback and use web analytics to improve applications.

item.title: USWDS Monthly Call - January 2023
item.description: Join the Design System team as we tackle your most commonly-asked questions.

item.title: USWDS Monthly Call - December 2022
item.description: A look back at what took place in the Design System in 2022.

item.title: USWDS Monthly Call - November 2022
item.description: Continuing our look at user profile patterns

item.title: USAGov: Usability Test Reports
item.description: Join us for an overview of usability test reports on the next version of USA.gov.

item.title: USWDS Monthly Call - October 2022
item.description: We’ll discuss our approach to developing User Profile design patterns, look at some specific guidance, and talk about why it’s so important.

item.title: Improve Your Website With User Testing
item.description: Get tips and lessons learned from the Environmental Protection Agency on how to conduct user testing to improve customer experience.

item.title: DHS Usability Testing Kit — So Easy, Anyone Can Do It
item.description: Join us for an overview of the Department of Homeland Security’s new Usability Testing Kit, including its four approaches to usability testing.

item.title: USWDS Monthly Call - September 2022
item.description: How do we help users find content in their preferred language? Join us as we take a closer look at the language selection patterns we’re developing for USWDS.

item.title: 2022 Federal Plain Language Summit
item.description: Join the best and brightest plain language practitioners from across the federal government.

item.title: USWDS Monthly Call - August 2022
item.description: Join us to learn more about design patterns and how they fit into the design system.

item.title: How Effective Is Your Communication?
item.description: Join us to learn about best practices for measuring communication and outreach efforts.

item.title: White House and GSA Open Innovation Forum: Building Equitable Partnerships
item.description: Celebrating OSTP’s biennial report to Congress on Implementation of Federal Prizes and Citizen Science Authority, Fiscal Years 2019 - 2020, and the role of community partnerships in the federal open innovation landscape.

item.title: Increase Your Impact With Plain Language
item.description: Get tips and lessons learned from the U.S. Department of Justice Civil Rights Division on using plain language to increase their impact and influence.

item.title: USWDS Monthly Call - June 2022
item.description: What you need to know before contributing to USWDS.

item.title: 2022 Government UX Summit
item.description: A two-day summit—June 7 and June 8—with experts who will share their experiences as UX practitioners in the federal government.

item.title: USWDS Monthly Call - May 2022
item.description: The U.S. Web Design System (USWDS) team will show you how to reduce CSS size and optimize build time with the design system.

item.title: How to Build Your Digital Dream Team
item.description: Learn how to get the right team in place to help you create a trusted, seamless online experience for all your customers.

item.title: Optimization Case Study: Performance, SEO, and Accessibility with CFPB
item.description: Join three technologists from the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) as they discuss methods used to ensure that the CFPB website is discoverable and fully accessible to all.

item.title: USWDS Monthly Call - April 2022
item.description: Our friends at Digital.gov will join us to talk through their experience migrating to USWDS 3.0.

item.title: Spotlight Chat on the CDC Open Epidemic Forecasting Community
item.description: A discussion with members of the CDC’s Epidemic Prediction Initiative on best practices and considerations when organizing crowdsourcing initiatives.

item.title: Change the Way Digital Work Gets Done
item.description: Learn about what a Digital End-to-End Efficiency (DEEE) Framework is and how you can get started digitizing and automating your digital processes.

item.title: USWDS Monthly Call - March 2022
item.description: During this event, the USWDS core team will preview what to expect in the new USWDS 3.0.

item.title: Plain Language + Compassion Help People in Crisis
item.description: Meet the content strategists who worked to transform FindTreatment.gov to connect people in crisis with the help that they need.

item.title: Language Connections: Tips to Create, Maintain, and Present Non-English Digital Content
item.description: Tips to help you improve access to your non-English digital content.

item.title: USWDS Monthly Call - February 2022
item.description: In this event, we will explore possibilities for a component API for the U.S. Web Design System.

item.title: USWDS Monthly Call - January 2022
item.description: New resources for developers who are new to USWDS.

item.title: Overcoming Your Fear of Data
item.description: Learn how to overcome resistance to data analytics and visualization, ask the right questions, and improve customer experience.

item.title: USWDS Monthly Call - December 2021
item.description: Get started with the design system and a how-to demo of template creation and a prototyping approach.

item.title: Results of the 2021 Federal Report Card
item.description: David Lipscomb from the Center for PL will review the results of this year’s Federal Plain Language Report Card and answer questions.

item.title: Successful Strategies for Telework and Hybrid Work Environments
item.description: Learn from and share with other federal colleagues from across the government strategies for succeeding at working, managing, supervising, collaborating, communicating, and more.

item.title: USWDS Monthly Call: October 2021
item.description: This month’s topic: Community, Connection & Contribution. How can our community help teams solve problems together?

item.title: How To Best Connect With Your Spanish-speaking Audience During an Emergency
item.description: The Multilingual Community of Practice is hosting a panel to share some successful social media strategies that you can use to connect with your Spanish-speaking audience during emergencies.

item.title: 2021 Federal Plain Language Summit
item.description: On 9/21/21, PLAIN’s Fourth Federal PL Summit showcases federal employees’ plain language projects. Topics include COVID-19 agency responses, accessibility, user experience, and career enhancement.

item.title: USWDS Monthly Call - September 2021
item.description: Let’s peer into the crystal ball and look into the future of USWDS.

item.title: FedRAMP & DAP Case Study Part 2: Reporting and Decision-Making
item.description: In this second part of our analytics case study series, we’ll address how to pull reporting and conduct analysis through the lens of your analytics strategy.

item.title: SocialGov Summer Sessions 2021
item.description: If you’re a federal employee, join us to learn about both intellectual property (8/25) and rules of conduct (8/26) in your agency’s social media.

item.title: FedRAMP & DAP Case Study Part 1: Assessing Analytics Strategy
item.description: In this two-part Analytics Case Study, we’ll speak with the GSA’s FedRAMP team about their analytics strategy, data collection, reporting, and subsequent decision-making for a new site launch.

item.title: Digital Meets Culture: Getting Your Culture in Line With Your Digital Strategy
item.description: Join Digital.gov’s Web Managers Community as they host a discussion with panelists from the Lab at OPM, National Institutes of Health, Navy Bureau of Medicine and Surgery, and Presidential Innovation Fellows. The panel will discuss how to align culture and digital strategy to build better digital services.

item.title: Using Plain Language To Tell Our Stories
item.description: Learn how to tell a story and figure out what role plain language plays in storytelling.

item.title: Digital Strategy at 1600 Pennsylvania Avenue: Q&A with Rob Flaherty, White House Director of Digital Strategy
item.description: Join us for a conversation with Robert Flaherty, a digital native leading digital strategy at the White House.

item.title: 2021 User Experience Summit
item.description: A 3-day remote summit covering User Experience (UX) management in the government.

item.title: USWDS Monthly Call - June 2021
item.description: In this month’s session, we’ll unpack the new pagination component—what design problem it solves, how it came to be, what the U.S. Web Design System team did to build it, and what you and your teams can do with it.

item.title: Plain Language Webinar: Using Words to Build Better Digital Experiences
item.description: Words make digital experiences human-centered, and require just as much thought as the branding and code. As federal agencies strive to use human-centered design, they need to remember that words and design work together. See how interfaces rely on language, and how your writing can make or break an experience. Learn principles for UX writing that anyone who works on digital products can apply to their own work.

item.title: Accessible Digital Content: Tips and Tricks
item.description: This webinar will present and demonstrate tips and tricks to address several common accessibility errors and issues that occur during digital content creation.

item.title: USWDS & Accessibility: Creating More Inclusive Federal Websites
item.description: How does USWDS address accessibility? Join us as we share tips and tools for addressing accessibility throughout the lifecycle!

item.title: Positioning Yourself as a Plain Language Editor
item.description: Learn how to brand yourself as a plain language expert and get the credit at work that you deserve!

item.title: Deep Fakes and Social Media
item.description: Deep fakes are an emerging threat that can disrupt agencies’ communication efforts and federal agencies should be prepared. Learn about deep fakes on social media, and how federal agencies can plan to combat a deep fake if they are targeted.

item.title: Federal Developmental Opportunities Workshop
item.description: The Federal Leadership and Professional Development Seminar Series (FLPDSS) is hosting a cross-agency workshop focusing on developmental opportunities for federal employees.

item.title: Social Media Spring Session 2021
item.description: Join the SocialGov Community of Practice for the latest updates on social media topics including advertising campaigns, content archiving, and podcasting.

item.title: Challenge and Prize Spotlight Chat with National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST)
item.description: Hear from NIST Innovation and Legal teams on the benefits of engaging legal counsel and establishing a legal framework for challenges and prize competitions in an agency.

item.title: USWDS Monthly Call - April 2021
item.description: Join the U.S. Web Design System team as they answer the crucial question, “Why use the design system?”

item.title: How Testing Your Documents Can Improve Plain Language Compliance
item.description: Usability testing isn’t only for websites. Come work with Dr. Ginny Redish and try out three techniques for quick and easy ways to test the usability of your documents.

item.title: Artificial Intelligence for Homeland Security: Developing the Strategy
item.description: The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) will present the work that led to the creation of the DHS AI Strategy to interagency partners.

item.title: Tag Managers Part 2: Configuration Framework
item.description: This session will help DAP users configure and use their tag manager, to augment their reporting on more advanced interactions with their websites.

item.title: USWDS Monthly Call - March 2021
item.description: Join the U.S. Web Design System team as we look at what’s in USWDS 2.11.0, our latest release.

item.title: Plain Language: Accessibility for Content
item.description: Come join us as we focus on concerns and opportunities shared by the Section 508 and plain language communities in Government!

item.title: Get your Idea Funded Through GSA's 10x Program
item.description: The purpose of the event is to raise awareness about 10x’s newest round of idea selections. We want attendees to learn about 10x, understand what it takes to submit, and feel empowered to submit.

item.title: Tag Managers Part 1: The Data Layer
item.description: This session will help the audience expand analysis capabilities by using the tag manager data layer!

item.title: How Chatbots Can Improve Customer Experience
item.description: Come see how various agencies have successfully deployed chatbots/AI to interact with the public and foster collaboration between teams!

item.title: USWDS Monthly Call - February 2021
item.description: Learn what’s next for the U.S. Web Design System and our 2021 Roadmap—what we’re planning to do this year, and why we’re planning to do it.

item.title: Virtual Teaching: Plain Language
item.description: We’ve all had to learn new modes of presenting and communicating now that we’re teleworking full-time and depend on online broadcast technology. But how can you engage students and teach a class while sitting in front of a laptop camera? Join Wendy Wagner-Smith from the Small Business Administration and find out!

item.title: USWDS Monthly Call - January 2021
item.description: Learn how journey maps and service blueprints help teams better understand how people really use our sites and services to do what they need to do.

item.title: 2020 Federal Report Card Briefing
item.description: David Lipscomb will review, The Annual Federal Report Card, which is a snapshot of how well the federal government is following the 2010 Plain Writing Act.

item.title: How To Navigate Challenges To Successfully A/B Test Your Emails
item.description: In this talk, we will provide better understanding of how CFPB conducts email A/B testing, see examples of email A/B tests, and discuss lessons learned.

item.title: USWDS Monthly Call - December 2020
item.description: Join the U.S. Web Design System team as we look at what’s in our latest release: USWDS 2.10.0!

item.title: Federal Social Media Week 2020!
item.description: 2020 has been an unprecedented year for challenges and opportunities in social media. SocialGov’s Federal Social Media Week 2020 will bring you some interesting perspectives on how to keep social media moving and successful for 2021.

item.title: Practical Tips for Accessible Content and Multilingual Websites
item.description: In this talk, we’ll focus on content creation and how accessibility supports multilingual work.

item.title: USWDS Monthly Call - November 2020
item.description: Join U.S. Web Design System Product Lead, Dan Williams, to hear about what’s next for the design system as we come to the end of 2020.

item.title: Customer Experience & Continuous Improvement: The USPS Digital Approach
item.description: This presentation lays out USPS.com’s continuous improvement approach and how it combines analytics and customer feedback with iterative heuristic reviews, design, and usability testing to monitor, improve, and evolve the USPS.com CX.

item.title: Women In Federal IT & Cyber Conference Panel Discussion #4: Veterans Day
item.description: Panelists will discuss the challenges of transitioning and the benefits of transitioning from military to civilian service in the IT field.

item.title: Overview of NIST Initiatives on Artificial Intelligence Standards, Principles, and Critical AI Issues
item.description: In this webinar, experts from the National Institute of Standards and Technology provide an overview of their key artificial intelligence initiatives including responsible, trustworthy, and explainable AI.

item.title: Federal Crowdsourcing Webinar Series, Episode 15 — 10x: Transforming Technology Through Agile Investments
item.description: In this webinar, we will discuss GSA’s incremental investment program, 10x, which is modeled after modern venture capital best practices and start up studios.

item.title: 2020 Federal Plain Language Summit
item.description: Join us for discussion from government and private-sector leaders on how to advance plain language in government communications. Hear lessons learned and victories of every size.

item.title: Analytics Case Study Part 3: Action
item.description: In this webinar, we’ll address how to use the analysis and insights you created using DAP Google Analytics, to take action.

item.title: USWDS Monthly Call - October 2020
item.description: In this talk, we will uncover some of these tricks, and show what we all can do to assure that deceptive design patterns stay out of the sites we build.

item.title: Federal Source Code Summit: Towards a Source Code Community
item.description: This summit brings together the federal community to share success stories and best practices for utilizing federal source code and open source software, and examine the implementation of the Federal Source Code policy.

item.title: Analytics Case Study Part 2: Analysis
item.description: In this workshop, we’ll address how to pull reporting and conduct analysis through the lens of your analytics strategy.

item.title: A Fresh Start With DevOps - Maybe
item.description: When legacy is used to define systems less than five years old, an agency can still encounter DevOps adoption challenges where you least expect them.

item.title: Operating Cloud Services Efficiently with Business-Driven IT
item.description: Program managers, IT acquisitions leads, and business-minded IT professionals will receive in-depth guidance to improve cloud efficiency, optimization, and effective cost controls.

item.title: USWDS Monthly Call - September 2020
item.description: Join U.S. Web Design System Product Lead, Dan Williams, as we talk about the three new components for the design system.

item.title: Federal Crowdsourcing Webinar Series, Episode 14: Putting Open Data to Work for America’s Communities
item.description: Learn how federal agencies can leverage The Opportunity Project’s adaptable toolkit to engage cross-sector collaborators and rapidly prototype digital products powered by federal open data.

item.title: Plain Language Basics: Online Workshop
item.description: Take this three-hour online workshop to learn how to write and edit in plain language.

item.title: Analytics Case Study Part 1: Assessment
item.description: In this workshop, we’ll address how to assess your web analytics strategy to ensure you’re pulling the most impactful and relevant data to enrich your analysis and understanding of your website performance.

item.title: USWDS Monthly Call - August 2020
item.description: Join U.S. Web Design System Product Lead, Dan Williams, as we talk about the design system and answer your questions.

item.title: Federal Crowdsourcing Webinar Series, Episode 13: Securing Water for Food’s Crowdsourcing Culture
item.description: In this webinar, we discuss how to embed crowdsourcing into the culture of a program to the benefit of the project team, and its participants.

item.title: Plain Language Basics: Online Workshop
item.description: Take this three-hour online workshop to learn how to write and edit in plain language.

item.title: Women In Federal IT & Cyber Conference Panel Discussion #3: Who’s Next?
item.description: Panelists will discuss the importance of developing the next generation of women leaders in IT and in the Federal government.

item.title: The Continuous DevOps Dilemma with Andrew Clay Shafer
item.description: Using DevOps to help change entrenched behaviors in organizations.

item.title: 2020 Government UX Summit: July 28, 29, and 30
item.description: A remote event covering user experience (UX) methods, service design, and managing UX in the government.

item.title: Analytics Lessons From Canada.ca
item.description: In this session, we’ll be joined by Nicholas Pjontek of Canada.ca. Nick will talk about some of the analytics goals, lessons, barriers, and successes in the government of Canada.

item.title: Women In Federal IT & Cyber Conference Networking Session #2
item.description: Participants will have the opportunity to virtually interact with top Federal CIOs, and discuss career development, leadership, and best practices on expanding a professional network.

item.title: USWDS Monthly Call: Form Components Update
item.description: For the July 2020 USWDS, Dan Williams, USWDS product lead, led a demonstration of several newly released USWDS components.

item.title: Women In Federal IT & Cyber Conference Panel Discussion #2: Expanding Our Network
item.description: Panelists will discuss the importance of expanding our professional network outside of our silos to become stronger leaders.

item.title: A Technical Overview of cloud.gov
item.description: In this webinar, we will provide a technical overview of cloud.gov including a visual representation of its architecture, marketplace services, content delivery networks, and how to engage with cloud.gov.

item.title: Federal Report Card Update
item.description: Learn how the Center for Plain Language is approaching the Federal Report Card and what agencies can do to get top grades.

item.title: Federal Crowdsourcing Webinar Series, Episode 12: How AFWERX Crowdsources an Innovation Culture
item.description: The Air Force is catalyzing innovation with a variety of partners.

item.title: Making Remote Work Work for Journey Mapping
item.description: Join us for a discussion about the value of journey mapping, and how to adapt the mapping process to make the most out of remote collaboration.

item.title: 10x Project Lightning Talks: 2020
item.description: 10x project teams will demonstrate their work to date and provide brief overviews of each project. We hope that these talks will highlight some of the most interesting work happening in government today and inspire others to submit ideas to 10x.

item.title: Shifting Your Metrics Mindset
item.description: In this session, we’ll discuss the classic suite of “marketing metrics” vs what’s more important to us in government “content-based metrics”.

item.title: Air Force COOL and 18F: Partnership and Flight Operations Software Agile Lessons Learned
item.description: Highlights from the Air Force Materiel Command & 18F partnership and the importance of organizational structure, roles of the core team, and user outreach for military and government DevOps.

item.title: Short Case Study: A/B Testing for Data-Driven Design
item.description: See how our Office of Strategic Communication used A/B testing to resolve a difference of opinion within a cross-functional design team.

item.title: USWDS Monthly Call: Design Modernization and the Importance of Designers
item.description: The June 2020 USWDS monthly focused on the design system and design modernization with guest speakers from 18F. Dan Williams, USWDS product lead, led the call and facilitated a live question and answer session with event attendees.

item.title: 2020 Census Language Support in 59 Non-English Languages
item.description: How the Census Bureau provided language assistance in 59 non-English languages for the 2020 Census.

item.title: Women In Federal IT & Cyber Conference Networking Session #1
item.description: Participants will have the opportunity to virtually interact with top Federal CIOs, and discuss career development, leadership, and best practices on developing a professional network.

item.title: Building for the 21st-Century Web with Federalist
item.description: Building, deploying, and hosting fast, secure, and compliant federal web sites and applications with Federalist.

item.title: How USAGov en Español Uses Quantitative and Qualitative Data to Meet the Needs of Its Audience
item.description: In this workshop, we will show how USAGov en Español collects and analyzes data from across several social media channels and the USAGov Contact Center to design and improve content and outreach strategies.

item.title: Women In Federal IT & Cyber Conference Panel #1: Designing a Network
item.description: The importance of surrounding yourself with those with similar technical skills, finding your niche, and designing a professional network. The concept of a professional network might be intimidating, why not start with those with similar interests and skills to create a core network. A core network prioritizes those with similar technical skills to build a strong foundation. You can expect to come away with a) the why of designing a core network, b) ways to identify people with similar skills, and c) steps you can take to design a strategic professional network.

item.title: Federal Crowdsourcing Webinar Series, Episode 11: Mobile Testing Program Makes Content More Accessible
item.description: Agencies optimize mobile experiences with help from federal testers.

item.title: Become a DAP Certified Analyst
item.description: In this session, we’ll tell you about the Digital Analytics Program’s Certified Analyst exam and how you can use it to demonstrate your analytics mastery!

item.title: USWDS Monthly Call - Cards, Forms, and Data Visualizations
item.description: The May 2020 USWDS monthly call revisited the design system’s card and forms components. Speakers also paid special attention to data visualization.

item.title: Procuring Cloud Services in Government
item.description: In this workshop, we will guide agencies through the streamlined Technology Transformation Services cloud acquisition process at the U.S. General Services Administration.

item.title: DevOps Lessons Learned from the Air Force’s Early Cloud Journey
item.description: Lessons learned in the areas of people, processes, and tools from early efforts in the Air Force’s journey to a multi-cloud environment.

item.title: The Average American Reader Needs You to Write (Even More) Clearly
item.description: Learn about the skills and needs of American readers, how we are failing our audiences, and ways to do better.

item.title: Federal Crowdsourcing Webinar Series, Episode 10: A precisionFDA Strike for Public Health
item.description: See how the U.S. Food and Drug Administration crowdsources to identify potential health risks.

item.title: You Are a Product Manager (Though You May Not Know It)
item.description: We will define product management, discuss how it’s used in the government context through a case study, and arm listeners with practices to use and evangelize product thinking.

item.title: Dr. Emily Shen on Secure Multi-Party Computation
item.description: Learn how organizations can securely collaborate using cryptographic technologies.

item.title: SocialGov Virtual Spring Session
item.description: Join SocialGov, the federal government’s social media community of practice, for our virtual Spring Session!

item.title: The Hero's Journey for Re-Skilling Talent (And Other Digital Adventures)
item.description: For those seeking ways to internally re-skill their workforce for digital transformation, a look at mythology reveals a recurring theme where those answering the call are involved in an iterative cycle of ’leveling-up’, a theme that may help change-agents set conditions for successful retention and growth of organic digital talent.

item.title: Federal Crowdsourcing Webinar Series, Episode 9: A Match Made in History
item.description: History Hub is a crowdsourcing platform that helps the public find historical records.

item.title: An Introduction to the Basics of DAP
item.description: New to DAP? No problem. Join us to learn about the reporting interface, common terminology, and basic reports. This 2.5 - 3 hour session is designed for novice users to “get off the ground” with DAP and Google Analytics.

item.title: Cloud.gov for Product Managers
item.description: In this webinar, we will answer commonly asked questions about cloud.gov and explain how using cloud.gov enables development teams to deploy applications quickly and securely.

item.title: USWDS Monthly Call - Easing into the Design System
item.description: Join U.S. Web Design System Product Lead, Dan Williams, as we talk about the design system and answer your questions.

item.title: The Intersection Between Plain Language and 508 Compliance
item.description: We’ll discuss how plain language intersects with 508 compliance requirements to make federal electronic documents and information technology accessible to people with disabilities.

item.title: AI Tech Workshop: How to Utilize the Open Source Jupyter Project for your Research
item.description: We’ll show you how easy it can be to wrangle data and engage in technical discussions surrounding data, artificial intelligence, machine-learning models.

item.title: Intro to Cloud Foundry on Cloud.gov
item.description: In this workshop, we demonstrate the basics of using the Cloud.gov platform as a developer.

item.title: Justifying the Web Analyst's Role in Your Organization
item.description: In this workshop, we’ll address how to think about justifying an analyst role on your team, and talk about the role’s many hats, as well as making the business case to your leadership team.

item.title: Navigating Acquisition and Procurement for Artificial Intelligence and Advanced Data Analytics
item.description: We will provide guidance on how to manage the process of procuring AI products, services, and technologies, including considerations, pitfalls, and lessons learned.

item.title: Why I Love My Agile Team!
item.description: Join us as we meet with Land Information New Zealand (LINZ) who is utilizing an agile approach to assist in further updating their topographical information and data.

item.title: Writing for the Accessible Web
item.description: Watch this special presentation featuring 18f Content Strategist, Ryan Johnson, where he discusses how you can effectively write accessible web content.

item.title: USWDS Monthly Call - Color Tokens Update
item.description: Watch U.S. Web Design System Product Lead, Dan Williams, as he talks about the design system and answers participant questions.

item.title: Readability Audits of Government Websites with Katherine Spivey
item.description: In this meeting, we’ll talk about readability audits and formulas and how they work—and don’t work—to improve web content and the users’ experience.

item.title: Federal Crowdsourcing Webinar Series, Episode 8: How NASA@WORK Ignites Ideas from Within
item.description: Learn how NASA’s workforce contributes inspiring ideas as part of internal idea competitions facilitated NASA@WORK program.

item.title: RPA Community of Practice: March All-Hands Meeting
item.description: Join the RPA Community of Practice online to discuss the next steps in accelerating the adoption of robotic process automation in the federal environment.

item.title: Survey Translation and the Inclusion of End Users in the Process
item.description: This talk will offer insights and tips on how to best design and translate surveys and other government materials aimed at reaching non-English speaking members of the public.

item.title: Making a Mobile-Friendly Website Using the ADAPT Model
item.description: The 21st Century Integrated Digital Experience Act (21st Century IDEA) requires federal websites to be “fully functional and usable on common mobile devices.” Mobile-friendliness, however, can mean a variety of things, depending on the perspective of a user. David Fern, co-lead of the MobileGov Community and the Federal Crowdsource Mobile Testing Program, knows a lot about making websites and content mobile-friendly. This webinar gives you insights into his approach—the ADAPT Model—which looks to ensure that websites are mobile-friendly:

item.title: Moving From Agile Towards DevOps With a Small Team
item.description: In this webinar, Chris Lauer will share some of the successes and failures as the Space Weather Prediction Center (SWPC) has adopted Agile, and our gradual move towards DevOps.

item.title: USWDS Monthly Call: Website Standards Panel Discussion
item.description: Join U.S. Web Design System Product Lead, Dan Williams, as we discuss the USWDS and answer your questions.

item.title: The YouTube Event Option
item.description: In this session, you’ll learn how to track plays of embedded YouTube videos on your DAP-enabled pages, and how to create reports for analysis.

item.title: Reaching America’s Veterans in the Digital Space
item.description: In this discussion, we’ll hear from the digital experts at the Department of Veterans Affairs on their successful strategies for reaching America’s veterans through digital platforms.

item.title: Federal Crowdsourcing Webinar Series, Episode 7: Crowdsourcing for Code
item.description: Learn how the Code.gov team, and every day contributors, are helping the U.S. government to expand its repository—and application—of open-source code as part of Code.gov’s Open Tasks initiative.

item.title: How Agencies Are Spreading Best Practices
item.description: Join the DevOps Community of Practice in a panel discussion as different agencies share technical best practices in various offices.

item.title: 10x Project Lightning Talks
item.description: In this webinar, 10x project teams demonstrate their work to date and provide brief overviews of each project. Topics range from federating data to agile budgeting to machine learning, and our hope is that these talks will inspire others to submit ideas to 10x.

item.title: USWDS Monthly Call: Using the USWDS Maturity Model
item.description: Join U.S. Web Design System Product Lead, Dan Williams, as we discuss the USWDS maturity model and answer your questions.

item.title: SocialGov Winter Meeting
item.description: Join us for talks by colleagues from NIST, IRS, USPTO, PlainLanguage.gov, and DC HSEMA who will speak on the latest social media topics and an opportunity to do some in-person networking.

item.title: Plain Language in 2020
item.description: A look ahead at the coming year, and what we’ll accomplish together.

item.title: U.S. Web Design System: December Monthly Call
item.description: Join U.S. Web Design System Product Lead, Dan Williams, as we discuss the USWDS and answer your questions.

item.title: DevOps Holiday Special Event: Nicolas Chaillan
item.description: Join the Chief Software Officer of the USAF to learn: How the DoD moved to Kubernetes and Istio.

item.title: NIST Director Rob Dimeo: Learning to Communicate Complex Data
item.description: In this talk, NIST Director Rob Dimeo will explore how sketchnoting can be used to communicate complex data in simple ways - to both internal and external audiences.

item.title: U.S. Web Design System: November Monthly Call
item.description: Join Dan Williams, U.S. Web Design System (USWDS) product lead, in our monthly call as he walks through the design system and answers your questions.

item.title: DAP Learning Series: Site Analysis, Live!
item.description: Join us for a live demonstration of a real site analysis - from defining website mission, goals, and KPIs, to pulling reporting to better understand site performance.

item.title: SocialGov Talk: Reaching Small Businesses in the Digital Environment
item.description: In this webinar, the social media experts from the U.S. Small Business Administration discussed how they find and communicate with small businesses on their social media platforms.

item.title: Jez Humble: Building and Scaling High Performing Technology Organizations
item.description: This talk presents the findings from the latest State of DevOps report, including how to measure the performance of software teams, what capabilities organizations should invest in to drive higher performance, and how software leaders can apply these findings in their own organizations.

item.title: An Introduction to the A/B Testing Community of Practice
item.description: We know there are many ways to use A/B testing to inform decision making at your agency – this is a quick introduction on the many ways CFPB has used it to improve UX across their website.

item.title: Workforce Modernization Workshop Part 1: Attract and Retain the Best Talent to Better Serve Our Citizens
item.description: In this workshop, we will answer the question of how to cultivate a workforce that is empowered to be as nimble and sophisticated as the products it procures.

item.title: Intro to Kanban, Part II
item.description: Part two of an introduction to Kanban and how to use it to model any flow-based process.

item.title: Intro to Kanban, Part I
item.description: Part one of an introduction to Kanban and how to use it to model any flow-based process.

item.title: Ginny Redish: How to Collaborate on Strategies
item.description: How does content strategy mesh with business, user experience (UX), and a marketing strategy?

item.title: Basics of Scrum, Part II
item.description: Scrum is the most widely used Agile software development methodology. This second session will go into more detail about what is happening during each of the Scrum ceremonies.

item.title: The National Language Service Corps Can Fulfill Your Translation Needs
item.description: An increase in demand for multilingual digital content, shrinking budgets, and rising translation costs have impacted federal agencies trying to offer information and services in languages other than English. Learn how the National Service Language Corps (NLSC) can help.

item.title: Basics of Scrum, Part I
item.description: Scrum is the most widely used Agile software development methodology. This session will cover the basics of Scrum at a very high level.

item.title: Happy 3rd Birthday, Code.Gov! What We’ve Learned Three Years In
item.description: As Code.gov begins our third trip around the sun, we want to take a look at where we’ve been, where we’re going in the world of open source, and the implementation of the federal source code.

item.title: Foundations of Agile, Part II
item.description: Part two of exploring the fundamentals of the Agile methodology will look at the external view of producing customer value and the difficulty of adopting Agile methods.

item.title: Foundations of Agile, Part I
item.description: This is the first of two sessions that will explore the fundamentals of the Agile methodology.

item.title: Political Savvy - Why It’s Important and How to Master It
item.description: Robert J. Huttenlocker, who currently serves as the Assistant Inspector General for Management at the Office of Inspector General of the U. S. Department of Agriculture, will be discussing the importance of being politically savvy and how to master it.

item.title: Federal Crowdsourcing Webinar Series, Episode 6: The FedRAMP Ideation
item.description: Betsy Steele, of the Federal Risk and Authorization Management Program (FedRAMP) team, shares how a crowdsourcing initiative invited the larger cybersecurity community to help inform the next iteration of government’s cloud security authorization program.

item.title: DAP Learning Series: A Deep Dive Into Behavior Reports
item.description: A deep dive into behavior reporting to help DAP users understand how to use it and what are the pitfalls.

item.title: October DevOps Community Meeting
item.description: An overview of multiple Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools followed by a deep-dive on how to setup a Gitlab Runner to perform GitOps functions including IaC deployments against multiple AWS environments.

item.title: U.S. Web Design System: October Monthly Call
item.description: Join Dan Williams, U.S. Web Design System (USWDS) product lead, in our monthly call as he walks through the design system and answers your questions.

item.title: SocialGov Fall Meeting - Podcasting!
item.description: Join the minds behind four top federal podcasts to learn how to create, produce, and promote professional podcasts that engage with audiences.

item.title: Study Design: Developing a Citizen Science Project that Delivers Results
item.description: Prior to developing a community-based data collection program, it is essential to think through the scientific process and the steps necessary to create a program where the data collected match your monitoring objectives and data use goals.

item.title: Using Neural Machine Translation for Multilingual Communication
item.description: With the sharp improvement in machine translation quality, the variety of government use cases for this technology has evolved.

item.title: SocialGov Talks: Leveraging Pop Culture With Paul Lester of the DOE
item.description: Learn from a social media expert at Department of Energy how to use pop culture references as a jumping off point to talk about your agency’s work.

item.title: DAP Learning Series: A Deep Dive Into Acquisition Reports
item.description: In this webinar, we’ll review the acquisition reporting section in-depth, and discuss usefulness of reports and where there may be gaps in data.

item.title: DevOps Community Monthly Meeting: DevOps for the Decennial Census
item.description: In this month’s Community meeting, we will hear from a Census team that is brand new to DevOps—failing fast and often, but learning lessons as they undergo a cultural transformation.

item.title: U.S. Web Design System: September Monthly Call
item.description: This month, we’ll take a look at the development process for a USWDS component and demonstrate how we start with a problem and work to a solution that could be shared across other websites.

item.title: How to Navigate the Complex World of Federal Digital Policy
item.description: Tori Garten will explore the multi-tiered challenge of understanding and governing federal digital policy in a complex and ever-changing digital world.

item.title: Plain Language Summit 2019
item.description: A day of talks and conversations on how to advance plain language in government communications, hosted by the federal Plain Language community of practice.

item.title: Federal Robotic Process Automation Industry Day
item.description: Designed to build collaborative public-private partnerships and inform federal employees, this day-long event will feature presentations from industry and government leaders, automation platform providers, automation systems integrators and consultancies, emerging technology experts, and more.

item.title: A Deep Dive Into the Guide to the Paperwork Reduction Act
item.description: We will hear from the teams behind the PRA Guide and explore why and how it was built, the methods they used, and what the team is doing to ensure a sustainable path for the future.

item.title: DevOps Community of Practice Monthly Meeting
item.description: In this talk, we will review how Recreation.gov is built and operated to achieve its uptime goal for millions of yearly transactions.

item.title: SocialGov Talks: Tips for LinkedIn Content Strategy, with Matt Ross
item.description: Matt Ross, of LinkedIn’s Marketing Solutions Government & Advocacy team, will share tips and best practices on how to improve your agency’s use of content to maximize engagement with your core audience.

item.title: DAP Learning Series: A Deep Dive Into Audience Reports
item.description: Build upon your audience report knowledge and learn how to leverage these reports to better understand your audience.

item.title: U.S. Web Design System: Aug Monthly Call
item.description: Join Dan Williams, U.S. Web Design System (USWDS) product lead, as he walks through the design system and answers your questions. This month we’ll take a look at bootstrapping USWDS, including how to add USWDS to a project and start designing in minutes.

item.title: Plain Language In-person Training: Writing Principles and Techniques
item.description: This in-person training for an update on plain writing principles and the Plain Writing Act of 2010 took place at GSA.

item.title: Federal Crowdsourcing Webinar Series, Episode 5: By the People
item.description: The Library of Congress is the largest library in the world. While often referred to as the research arm of Congress, it is hardly limited to lawmakers. It is open to the public who, in fact, are also helping to make their digital collections more accessible and available to all.

item.title: Machine Learning: How Bureau of Labor Statistics Did It
item.description: The Bureau of Labor Statistics has been on a journey to improve their data reporting, using and iterating on machine learning, from algorithms to deep neural networks with lessons for everyone on this path.

item.title: DAP Learning Series: Misunderstood Metrics
item.description: What are some examples of misunderstood metrics, and how and when should you use them? We’ll talk about these metrics and their potential misinterpretations and pitfalls.

item.title: American Tech Series, Part Two: Advancing User-centric Design in Government
item.description: In part two of this multi-part YouTube Live series, learn how User-centered design is a practice honed by the American tech industry

item.title: DevOps Community of Practice Monthly Meeting
item.description: Overview of the HUD Real Estate Assessment Center (REAC) IT team, program, structure, and their shift to DevOps.

item.title: U.S. Web Design System: How to Migrate Your Site to USWDS 2
item.description: In our July meeting, the USWDS team and special guests walk through migrating sites to USWDS 2 and take any questions you might have.

item.title: An Introduction to 10x and How to Get Your Idea Funded
item.description: Learn how you can work with the new investment fund for technology products in the government.

item.title: Sharpen Your Social Skills for Summer
item.description: Learn how to develop creative content for social media, make your photos stand out, and sharpen your Instagram skills.

item.title: Federal Plain Language Report Card Planning
item.description: Come and help us plan for this year’s federal report card review.

item.title: Federal Crowdsourcing Webinar Series, Episode 4: Open Opportunities
item.description: The Open Opportunities program is a “win-win” for federal employees looking to refresh their skills and U.S. agencies seeking talent, energy, and enthusiasm from across a diverse cross-section of the federal workforce.

item.title: Data Storytelling With the Presidential Innovation Fellows
item.description: A two-hour workshop with Presidential Innovation Fellows to learn how to give your data its best story possible.

item.title: Government API Community of Practice - Quarterly Check-In
item.description: This afternoon event is an opportunity for API practitioners from across federal agencies to come together, share news, and discuss topics of interest. Remote participants will be able to join in via Google Hangout. Anyone with a federal .gov or .mil address is welcome to attend.

item.title: DAP Learning Series: Agency Analytics Governance
item.description: We’ll talk to members of various agencies to find out how analytics programs and tools are governed at that agency.

item.title: American Tech Series, Part One: Why Leave the Private Sector?
item.description: In part one of this multi-part YouTube Live series, learn how civic technologists work to better our government.

item.title: U.S. Web Design System: June Monthly Call
item.description: Join the U.S. Web Design System team as we walk through the system’s design tokens and take any questions you might have!

item.title: GSA Customer Experience Hackathon 2019
item.description: A day focused on designing a better customer experience with and within government.

item.title: U.S. Government Open Innovation Summit
item.description: Presentations that highligh the potential and impact of crowdsourcing through citizen science and prize competitions in the U.S. government

item.title: How to Develop an Agency Brand Voice That Connects With Customers Online
item.description: Come join the Plain Language community on the 12th of June and learn how to develop an agency brand voice!

item.title: Introduction to Search.gov
item.description: Come and learn all about Search.gov! The site search for federal government websites

item.title: Federal Crowdsourcing Webinar Series, Episode 3: The Opportunity Project
item.description: The Opportunity Project engages government, communities, and the technology industry to create digital tools that address our greatest challenges as a nation. Learn how this initiative is making government data more accessible through cross-sector collaboration.

item.title: Executive Core Qualifications (ECQs) – How to Assess, Achieve, and Demonstrate ECQs
item.description: Come learn all about Executive Core Qualifications. Cheryl Abram, Lead Evaluation for OPM’s Federal Executive Institute (FEI), will be discussing how to assess, achieve, and demonstrate ECQs.

item.title: Mobile Community of Practice Spring Meeting
item.description: Join us to learn about the latest developments in the mobile citizen experience. and discuss recent developments and highlight opportunities

item.title: DAP Learning Series: Using the analytics.usa.gov API
item.description: Learn how Analytics.usa.gov, the public window into how the public interacts with federal government websites, uses an API and allows you to query data in machine-readable formats.

item.title: U.S. Web Design System: May Monthly Call
item.description: Join the U.S. Web Design System team as we talk through the recent update to 2.0

item.title: 2019 Virtual Student Federal Service (VSFS) Info Session
item.description: An overview of how your agency can participate in this year’s VSFS program.

item.title: Government UX Summit 2019
item.description: Sponsored by the User Experience Community of Practice (UX CoP) and DigitalGov, this event is an opportunity to share experiences and lessons learned in UX and network with other UX practitioners from across the government.

item.title: Federal Crowdsourcing Webinar Series, Episode 2: Challenge.gov
item.description: Need help solving a problem? Join Challenge.gov to learn how federal agencies can use prize competitions to reach innovators in novel ways.

item.title: Innovative Approaches to the Opioid Crisis
item.description: Join federal, state and local governments and the broader community in an exploration of crowdsourcing approaches to address the opioid crisis.

item.title: Indexing with Search.gov
item.description: Come take a walk through the Search.gov indexing process from start to finish.

item.title: DAP Learning Series: Using the Advanced Analysis Tool
item.description: We’ll demo the Advanced Analysis tool and show how you can use it to better understand your data and create drag-and-drop reports!

item.title: Crowdsourcing for Access & Engagement at the Library of Congress
item.description: Learn how the Library is utilizing user-centered design to invite the public to explore, transcribe, and tag historical materials through a new open source platform.

item.title: An Introduction to the U.S. Data Federation
item.description: Find out how the U.S. Data Federation’s work can help you. The team will give an introduction to the problems the U.S. Data Federation seeks to address, describe its approach, and share its vision for the future of the initiative.

item.title: An Introduction to the DHA Usability Lab
item.description: Join us for an overview of the DHA Usability Lab, and the resources they provide to improve customer experience.

item.title: Principles of Speaking Plainly
item.description: This seminar adapts principles of plain language to the context of speaking, covering not only wording but also structure and integration with visual aids.

item.title: Caroline Jarrett on How to Design a Better Form
item.description: We have a lot of forms in government, and many of them would benefit from better design. In this talk, Caroline Jarrett will explore a curriculum she’s working on about how to design forms.

item.title: Federal Crowdsourcing Webinar Series, Episode 1: Citizen Science
item.description: This is the first installment of GSA’s Federal Crowdsourcing Webinar Series, where we look at how to use crowdsourcing to reach beyond your walls and source talent and enthusiasm.

item.title: Federal Leadership & Professional Development Seminar Series: Professional Branding
item.description: Reginald Gant, a human resources specialist for the Office of Learning, Strategy, and Workforce Development at the Social Security Administration, will be discussing what branding is, why it is important, and the 6-step branding process.

item.title: Government API Community of Practice - Quarterly Check-In
item.description: This afternoon event is an opportunity for API practitioners from across federal agencies to come together, share news, and discuss topics of interest.

item.title: DAP Learning Series: Understanding When to Use Sessions vs. Unique Pageviews
item.description: In this webinar, Freddie Blicher, an analyst for the Digial Analytics Program, will discuss how to think about sessions and unique pageviews in reporting and content analysis.

item.title: Managing Your Plain Language Career
item.description: We’ll discuss how to document and publicize your formal and informal plain language work — teaching, training, reviewing, or copyediting.

item.title: Dalia El-Shimy on Mixed Methods Design Research
item.description: How should designers collect data and how can they use that data to inform their work? Dalia El-Shimy, UX Research Lead at Shopify’s Montreal Office, will share how her team uses mixed methods research in support of its design decisions.

item.title: Analyzing Web Metrics for Federal Privacy Professionals
item.description: For this event, DAP has partnered with the fine folks who run the Federal Privacy Council’s Tech Tuesday Series to teach us how to measure, analyze, and improve experiences for users visiting privacy pages on your agency websites.

item.title: Emerging Technology Leadership Series: Laura Manley, Harvard Technology and Public Purpose Project
item.description: In this next installment of the Emerging Technology Leadership Series we will discuss with Laura Manley, director of Harvard TAPP, what agencies should know about better understanding and managing potential risks from promising emerging technologies.

item.title: Emerging Technology for Government Services Meeting
item.description: This is an opportunity to discuss what agencies need to know about current issues in emerging technologies for IT modernization and form consensus on inter-agency collaboration and resource development, and shape initiatives that empower teams across government.

item.title: December PLAIN Meeting and Holiday Gathering
item.description: Join us for our traditional winter finger-food potluck where we’ll discuss the Clarity 2018 conference and plan out our 2019 meetings.

item.title: Responding to the Federal Plain Language Report Card
item.description: We will discuss the Federal Plain Language Report Card and how to address the issues the report card brings up.

item.title: DAP Learning Series: Basics of A/B Testing Part 2
item.description: We’ve teamed up with our friends at CFPB to bring you a two-part series on A/B Testing.

item.title: DAP Learning Series: Basics of A/B Testing Part 1
item.description: We’ve teamed up with our friends at CFPB to bring you a two-part series on A/B Testing.

item.title: Government API Community - Quarterly Check-In
item.description: An opportunity for API practitioners from across federal agencies to come together, share news, and discuss topics of interest.

item.title: DAP Learning Series: Creating Goals and Conversions
item.description: This online event will cover the Goals feature in Google Analytics.

item.title: GSA Future Services Now: Emerging Tech for Government Services
item.description: A half-day symposium on emerging technologies with leading agencies, industry, and civic collaborators.

item.title: A Conversation with Evan Papp of Power Africa
item.description: Evan Papp will talk about a video and story he produced while traveling internationally in Africa.

item.title: DAP Learning Series: Writing Custom JavaScript for Tag Managers
item.description: This online event will focus on how to track specific events and write JavaScript to maximize the tag manager experience

item.title: Getting Started with USWDS 2.0
item.description: The U.S. Web Design System team will show you how to get started with USWDS 2.0: how to set up your project colors, fonts, and more.

item.title: DAP Learning Series: An Introduction to the Basics
item.description: This online class will provide an introductory training on how to use Digital Analytics Program (DAP) google analytics data.

item.title: Performance Goals for Government Services / August 2018 Inter-agency Emerging Citizen Technology Meeting
item.description: How agencies can align their emerging technology for government services programs with Cross-Agency Priority Goals (CAP Goals) on Performance.gov and other strategic priorities.

item.title: Emerging Technology Leadership Series: AI for Government Services with Mina Hanna
item.description: Mina Hanna is the chair of the Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers’ (IEEE) Artificial Intelligence and Autonomous Systems Policy Committee. He will share what federal managers need to know to understand this increasingly complex and expanding field.

item.title: Civic Service Design Tools + Tactics
item.description: Join us for this hour long webinar to receive an introduction on the Civic Service Design Tools + Tactics, a set of practical ways to gather insights from the people who depend on your services in their own environments.

item.title: Plain Language Summit 2018
item.description: The federal Plain Language community is holding their first all-day summit in Washington D.C., and you’re invited!

item.title: DAP Learning Series: Analytics and Accessibility
item.description: This online event will cover how to check if behaviors change when people are using keystrokes to click, which might give insight into how users with disabilities interact with your site

item.title: Emerging Technology Leadership Series: Brian Behlendorf and Blockchain
item.description: The Emerging Technology Leadership Series, hosted by the U.S. General Services Administration Emerging Citizen Technology Office, is a six-part livestream pilot to enhance the modern federal workforce with training, education and awareness of emerging technologies including Artificial Intelligence, Robotic Process Automation, Blockchain, Social Technologies and Virtual/Augmented Reality.

item.title: An Inside Look at How the FBI Develops Engaging Video
item.description: Do you want to learn how to create a successful video strategy from beginning to end?

item.title: Government API Community of Practice - Quarterly Check-In
item.description: This afternoon event is an opportunity for API practitioners from across federal agencies to come together, share news, and discuss topics of interest. Remote participants will be able to join in via Google Hangout. Anyone with a federal .gov or .mil address is welcome to attend.

item.title: PLAIN Language: Forms-a-palooza
item.description: Join the the Plain Language Community of Practice for an hour-long conversation about how best to revise forms and convince your agency that the long-term benefits outweigh the cost.

item.title: What You Need to Know: Required Prize Reporting to Congress
item.description: Federal employees who have been involved in running a prize competition for their agencies at any point during fiscal years 2017 and 2018 should attend this information session on prize reporting.

item.title: A First Look at USWDS 2.0
item.description: This month, the USWDS team will share what’s coming up in version 2.0 which is set to launch later this summer.

item.title: Usability Testing with Steve Krug
item.description: Join us for a 90-minute demonstration and talk with Steve Krug, where he will share how you can get started making usability fixes, no matter what your full-time job is.

item.title: Funding the Future: Technology Modernization Fund Proposal Workshop
item.description: GSA’s Emerging Citizen Technology Office (ECTO) and the Technology Modernization Fund Program Management Office (TMF PMO) are hosting an online workshop at GSA on June 8, 2018 to hands-on assist agencies with developing proposals for TMF that advance emerging technologies and programs that can improve our services and reduce costs for the American people today and in the coming years. Emerging technology solutions employed by agencies across government, combined with the operational rigor and funding of the Technology Modernization Fund (TMF), hold the potential to drive to incredible performance enhancements in public services.

item.title: DAP Learning Series: Using the Search Console
item.description: This online class will dive deeper into the benefits of integrating Google Search Console with your independently managed Google Analytics account

item.title: Free & Open Source Software in Government with Code.mil
item.description: Join the Code.mil team for a discussion on open source in government and a look at the important work they have been doing on Code.mil to enable greater adoption of open source at the DoD.

item.title: U.S. Web Design System Monthly Call
item.description: Join us for our monthly conversation with designers and developers across the government.

item.title: How Design Systems Help Us Work Together — with Brad Frost
item.description: Join Brad Frost as he talks about design systems and the role they play in creating a successful, collaborative structure for modern organizations.

item.title: How Search Engines Index Your Websites
item.description: Join Search.gov as they walk you through the fundamentals of how search engines monitor your content and pull relevant data from your pages.

item.title: Get to Know the Virtual Student Federal Service
item.description: Learn how U.S. college students working remotely can be virtual interns for you and your federal government teams through the Virtual Student Federal Service.

item.title: DAP Learning Series: Advanced Concepts
item.description: This half-day online class will expand upon the basics of Google Analytics.

item.title: An Overview of the Technology Modernization Fund (TMF)
item.description: The Technology Modernization Fund (TMF) Program Management Office and the GSA Emerging Citizen Technology Office (ECTO) are hosting a conversation to help agencies develop proposals for technology modernization projects.

item.title: Federal Challenge & Prize Community of Practice Quarterly Meeting
item.description: Crowdsourcing experts from around the federal government come together to discuss trends, success stories and lessons learned in the use of competitions.

item.title: An Introduction to Search.gov
item.description: Learn about the essential features of Search.gov and tour its Admin Center.

item.title: U.S. Web Design System Monthly Call
item.description: Join us for our monthly conversation with designers and developers across the government.

item.title: U.S. Government API Community of Practice - Quarterly Check-In
item.description: This afternoon event is an opportunity for API practitioners from across federal agencies to come together, share news, and discuss topics of interest. Anyone with a federal .gov or .mil address is welcome to attend.

item.title: DAP Learning Series: Creating Your Own Campaign URL Builder
item.description: This online event will cover how to create a campaign URL in Google Analtyics and how to effectively implement it.

item.title: A Deep Dive Into Top Tasks with Gerry McGovern
item.description: This talk will focus on how using the top tasks approach will help you deliver what your customers want to make it easier and faster for people to do things they need to do with government.

item.title: Creating Videos in Languages Other Than English
item.description: Join the Multilingual and Video Production Pros Communities of Practice for a talk about a video the CFPB created, for a Spanish speaking audience.

item.title: Marketing-as-a-Service: An Introduction to USAGov's Partnership Toolkit
item.description: The USAGov team will talk about their new Partnership Toolkit and focus on how government agencies can partner with USAGov to market various programs and services.

item.title: DAP Learning Series: A Deep Dive into Analytics Events
item.description: This online event will focus on events in Google Analytics

item.title: Conversations on Public Impact: How data trusts can preserve and protect your digital initiatives
item.description: The Ethics Working Group in GSA’s Technology Transformation Service hosts a presentation about data trusts; a legal structure designed to manage data, code, and other digital assets.

item.title: Video Production Pros Roundtable
item.description: Join the Video Production Pros Community for our first meeting, to share inspiration, to discuss the future of the community and how you can get involved.

item.title: Infographics: Plain Language Considerations
item.description: The March meeting of the Plain Language Community of Practice will focus what makes an infographic easy to understand

item.title: Federal Challenge & Prize Community of Practice Quarterly Meeting
item.description: This quarterly meeting brings together federal employees from a range of agencies to discuss trends, success stories and lessons learned in the use of crowdsourcing competitions.

item.title: DAP Learning Series: An Introduction to the Basics
item.description: This online class will provide an introductory training on how to use Digital Analytics Program (DAP) google analytics data.

item.title: Plain Language Community Meeting
item.description: This in-person meeting of the Plain Language Community of Practice will focus on volunteers.

item.title: U.S. Digital Registry Open Office Hours
item.description: Virtual open office hours to answer your questions about the U.S. Digital Registry.

item.title: Customer Relationship Management - Government Sector Best Practices, Pitfalls and Tips
item.description: Join the CX Community for their first meeting of 2018 where CRM in government will be discussed.

item.title: U.S. Web Design Standards Monthly Users Call
item.description: In our next monthly users call, the U.S. Web Design Standards core team will share what they’re working on in 2018.

item.title: How to Better Serve Your LEP Audience by Meeting the Federal Requirements
item.description: Learn about your legal obligations to limited English proficient individuals (LEP) as a federal, state, or local government agency. We’ll provide an overview of national origin discrimination and offer practical tips for overcoming language barriers and language access program planning.

item.title: January PLAIN Monthly Meeting
item.description: Monthly meeting of the Plain Language Community of Practice.

item.title: U.S. Digital Registry Open Office Hours
item.description: Virtual open office hours to answer your questions about the U.S. Digital Registry

item.title: Responding to a Disaster: How USAGov Helped Shape the Digital Response in Puerto Rico
item.description: This interactive talk with a USAGov team member will highlight the digital response in Puerto Rico during and after Hurricane Maria.

item.title: Inter-agency Federal Emerging Citizen Technologies Forum
item.description: First monthly inter-agency form for the Emerging Citizen Technology program.

item.title: Workshop: Making Government Websites with GitHub, Federalist & U.S. Web Design Standards
item.description: Come learn how to create a simple, compliant government website, using Federalist, GitHub and the U.S. Web Design Standards.

item.title: Connect With Your Spanish-Language Audience on Social Media
item.description: This event will provide concrete tips and examples of how to reach more Spanish speakers needing and looking for government information through social media

item.title: DAP Learning Series – Visualizing Analytics Data Part 2
item.description: In this online event, we’ll discuss how to use tools that are designed to import data and visualize it without report exports.

item.title: An Around the World Recap PLAIN Monthly Meeting
item.description: In this online event, PLAIN co-chairs will provide a recap of international plain language initiatives discussed at the 2017 Plain Language Association International conference in Graz, Austria.
